div.p: The plugin allows users to interact with the Oracle WebLogic server, such as starting and deploy application, starting Managed Servers and running Jython scripts.
To manage your WebSphere configuration, go to Administration > Plugins and click the EC-WebSphere Configure link.

Configurations have the following properties:
Configuration name - The name of the configuration.
URL - The URL for the WebLogic server, it must include protocol and port (example: t3://localhost:7001).
Credential - Username and password for the WebLogic server.

To use the plugin, you must first create a step. There are two ways to create steps:
Wizard step: When creating a procedure, do the following:
Click Add Step on the Steps panel.
Select the Subprocedure category.
In the Project field, select EC-WebLogic.
In the Procedure field, select the procedure you wish to execute.
Click OK.
Subprocedure step: To add a step to a procedure, do the following:
Go to the Procedure Details page for the procedure where you want to add the step.
Click the arrow adjacent to Create Step.
Select Subprocedure Step.
In the Project field, click Browse and select EC-WebLogic.
In the Procedure field, click Browse and select the procedure you wish to execute.
Click OK.
The subprocedure you select determines which fields are available.
The StartManagedServer subprocedure starts a specified managed server instance on the selected resource machine. The following fields are available for StartManagedServer:

ul.li: configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
instancename - Name of the instance to start.
scriptlocation - Absolute path of the start server script. It must include filename and extension.

div.p: The StartAdminServer subprocedure starts a specified admin server instance on the selected resource machine. The following fields are available for StartAdminServer:

ul.li: scriptlocation - Absolute path of the start server script. It must include filename and extension.

div.p:
The StopManagedServer subprocedure stops a specified managed server on the selected resource. The following fields are available for StopManagedServer:
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
instancename - Name of the instance to stop.
scriptlocation - Absolute path of stop server script. It must include filename and extension.

The StopAdminServer subprocedure stops a specified Admin Server instance on the selected resource. The following fields are available for StopServer:
additionalcommands - Additional parameters received by the stop server script.
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
instancename - Name of the instance to stop.
scriptlocation - Absolute path of stop server script. Blank indicates that the script is loaded in the system's path.

The CheckServerStatus subprocedure checks the status of the specified URL, by getting the returned HTTP code from the server. Curl is used in this subprocedure.
The following fields are available for CheckServerStatus:

ul.li: additionalcommands - Additional parameters received by curl.
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page). In this case, only credentials are taken from the configuration.
url - URL to check.
usecredentials - Indicates if credentials must be appended to the URL.

div.p: The RunCustomJob subprocedure is able to run Jython scripts on the server using wsadmin. The following fields are available for RunCustomJob:

ul.li: additionalcommands - Additional parameters received by wsadmin.
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
classpath - Use this option to make additional classes available to your scripting process. Separate absolute paths of jars to add with a semicolon (;).
commands - Runs commands using wsadmin. Enter one command per line.
connectiontype - Type of connection to establish with the server.
javaparams - Java options to add to the process. Separate each Java option with a semicolon (;).
scriptfileabspath - Absolute path the Jython script to be executed by wsadmin.
wsadminabspath - Absolute path of wsadmin. Leaving this blank assumes it is loaded in the system's path.

div.p: The StartApp subprocedure is able to start an application on the server using wsadmin. The following fields are available for StartApp:

ul.li: additionalcommands - Additional parameters received by wsadmin.
appname - Name of the application to start.
configname - The name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server (created on the Configure page).
classpath - Use this option to make additional classes available to your scripting process. Separate absolute paths of jars to add with a semicolon (;).
commands - Runs commands using wsadmin. Enter one command per line.
connectiontype - Type of connection to establish with the server.
javaparams - Java options to add to the process. Separate each Java option with a semicolon (;).
wsadminabspath - Absolute path of wsadmin, including filename and extension.
